skill.name: blog-creator
skill.description: Create SEO-optimized MDX blog posts with proper frontmatter
skill.summary: Create SEO-optimized MDX blog posts with proper frontmatter
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown files providing guidelines for creating MDX blog posts. No scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Creating SEO-friendly blog posts requires proper formatting, metadata, and structure. This skill provides clear guidelines for creating MDX blog posts with correct frontmatter, tags, and image handling for maximum search visibility.
actual_capabilities: Generate MDX blog posts with proper frontmatter structure
Add SEO-optimized title, description, and meta tags
Configure featured images with correct paths
Apply relevant tags for related articles functionality
limitations: Does not generate actual content - only provides structure and guidelines
Does not interact with file system to create files
Does not validate or publish posts to any platform
Does not generate images or media assets

use_cases.title: Create Blog Post Structure
use_cases.description: Generate properly formatted blog posts with correct frontmatter for SEO optimization

use_cases.title: Set Up Blog Content
use_cases.description: Configure blog posts with correct MDX syntax and file structure for Next.js projects

use_cases.title: Maintain Content Standards
use_cases.description: Follow consistent naming conventions and metadata standards across all blog posts

prompt_templates.title: New Blog Post
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new MDX blog post about [TOPIC] with proper frontmatter including title, tags, featuredImage, createdDate, and description. Use kebab-case for the filename.

prompt_templates.title: SEO Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the best practices for writing SEO-optimized frontmatter for a blog post about [TOPIC]? Include recommended description length and tag suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Image Configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure the featured image for my blog post. The image is located at [PATH]. What frontmatter field should I use and how should I reference it?

prompt_templates.title: Content Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this blog post frontmatter and check if it follows the correct schema. [PASTE FRONTMATTER] What needs to be fixed?

output_examples.input: Create a blog post about getting started with the product
output: Frontmatter: title, tags (guide, tutorial, getting-started), featuredImage, createdDate, description

best_practices: Use kebab-case for filenames to generate clean URLs
Keep descriptions between 150-160 characters for optimal SEO
Include 3-5 relevant tags to enable related articles functionality
anti_patterns: Using single quotes instead of double quotes in frontmatter
Skipping the description field which is used for meta tags
Not using absolute paths for image references

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides prompts and guidance for creating blog content.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports MDX format only. Files must have .mdx extension with YAML frontmatter.

faq.question: Does this skill create actual files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides structure and guidelines. The AI generates the content and you save it to your project.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation. No code executes, no files are read, and no data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why is my description not showing in SEO?
faq.answer: Check that you use double quotes, not single quotes, in frontmatter. Also verify the description field is present and under 160 characters.

faq.question: How is this different from other blog tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on MDX and frontmatter structure for Next.js projects. It ensures proper SEO metadata and component compatibility.
